p: In the neutrality test, the Fu’s Fs statistic values were very low in the two native countries of BMSB, China and Japan, with − 7.852 ( p < 0.02) and − 29.707 ( p < 0.02) (Table 2) while for the BMSB-invaded countries, Fu’s Fs statistic value was − 1.174 ( p < 0.02) for group A (Chile, Georgia, Hungary, Italy, Romania, Turkey and the USA) suggesting that group A was under population expansion. In comparison, the haplotype diversity was slightly higher with an average of 0.63 for group B (Austria, Serbia, and Slovenia), but with Fu’s Fs values of 1.453 ( p > 10), indicating that group B was under bottleneck.
